means: 阿尔贡金语，阿尔冈昆人

sentence.Network_en: The Algonquian language of the Penobscot, a dialect of Eastern Abenaki.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种东阿贝那基方言佩诺布斯科特语(指其使用的阿尔冈昆语 )

sentence.Network_en: The algonquian language of the Cheyenne.
sentence.Network_cn: 夏延人所用的语音,属阿耳冈昆语族.

sentence.Network_en: A member of the Algonquian people formerly inhabited the Maritime Provinces of Canada.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个以前住在加拿大的沿海诸省,属于阿尔冈琴语系的民族的人.

means.word_mean: 1. a member of any of the North American Indian groups speaking an Algonquian language and originally living in the subarctic regions of eastern Canada; many Algonquian tribes migrated south into the woodlands from the Mississippi River to the Atlantic coa
2. family of North American Indian languages spoken from Labrador to South Carolina and west to the Great Plains
1. of or relating to an Algonquian tribe or its people or language
